column4: hello, is it possible to grab files in the PC (same network) with ubuntu notebook ?
yes, you can share a directory from your Windows machine and access it through Places-Connect to Server
i'd make the folders in vista shared, then from nautilus, i go to the network and the PC, but can't find any files, why is that ?
use Places-Connect to Server instead
oh sorry, i try it first
i don't have any server, just a router, what should i do ?
the Windows machine becomes the server when you share a "folder" (directory)
so if the shared file in f:/ , i just enter f:/ ?
no. When you shared it, you gave the share a name. Use that.
ok, let me try , thx for the clue
in the service type, i choose windows share, then in the server i enter "multimedia" then it stated "cannot display smb://multimedia, No application is registered as handling this file
is "multimedia" the network name of the Windows machine?
yes, when i click share file in the windows explorer, i give name multimedia
read my question carefully: is "multimedia" the network name of the Windows machine?
wait a sec, i recheck first
is network name in windows = network path ? if so, the network path is Hendri-pc/F
no, what you enter under Server in that case is Hendri-PC (without the /F)
i tried, with Hendri-pc, same error, but with Hendri-pc/F, it works, but asking for password ... what password ? i don't think i set a password for the sharing ......
then set one
u mean, i must set password in windows first ?
yes
ahh :) i tried my login password in the PC and it works !! :) thx so  much soundray, hope i can copy files now :)
